conclusion: Analyze forces to keep rope CD horizontal.
Weight m at C exerts downward force mg; tensions in ropes are T_AC, T_BC, T_CD; force F applied at D.
Points A and B are 2L apart; each rope has length L.
Vertical components of tensions in AC and BC must balance weight mg.
Vertical component of tensions is T_AC sin θ and T_BC sin θ; 2T sin θ = mg.
Horizontal components of tensions in AC and BC must be balanced by force F at D; 2T cos θ = F.
Horizontal distance from A to C (or B to C) is L cos θ; total horizontal distance is 2L cos θ = 2L, so cos θ = 1 and θ = 0.
Re-evaluate geometry; consider triangle formed by A, B, C; assume system is symmetric.
Calculate minimum force F: F = 2T cos θ; T = mg / (2 sin θ); F = mg cot θ.
Determine θ for minimum force; θ maximized when ropes are vertical.
Final answer: Minimum force F is mg.
